p: P. Matthiolus (1501–1577) describes tarragon (German version Dragoncell, Dracuncellus, Dragoncellus, Dracunculus esculentus) with the following: sharp taste, warming effect, stimulating the appetite (int.), externally applied with saliva, leaves crushed, mixed with honey, smeared causes bruises to disappear (Avicenna calls it “tarcon”) ( Mattioli, 1586).
